intro: Adicea subserrata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rock rose, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often colorful flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and often have a serrated edge, giving it its scientific name. Adicea subserrata produces small, pink or white flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
